programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines the social significance of cars in the 20th century. He begins by travelling to Germany, Italy and Russia to examine how dictators kick-started the mobilization of the masses, finding tales of design brilliance, abject failure, war, fraud and double dealing. James also learns about how the British motor industry blew a gift-wrapped chance to rule the world and he gets his own back with a stunt that means bad news for one of the planet's most hated cars.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter continues his examination of how the car became an everyday part of people's lives, exploring the weird world of small vehicles. He discovers how austerity and fears of congestion led to European disasters in the shape of Britain's infamous three-wheelers, French death traps and German absurdities, and also takes to the battlefield to settle one of the greatest rivalries in car history.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history.

On a five-day expedition through the highest mountains, deepest gorges and harshest terrain on the planet, Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris battle huge river crossings, vast mudslides and dizzying mountain passes on a trip that would test even the hardiest new 4x4s to the limit. programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Norman Conquest of Pembrokeshire
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. With its numerous castles and a fine cathedral, there are sure signs the Normans stamped their mark over the area. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Nazi Occupation - Channel Islands
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Guernsey and Jersey to tell the story of the islands' surrender to the Nazis during the Second World War. In Guernsey, he hears of the first bombing raid that heralded the German troops' arrival and sees the spot where the first-ever British commando landed in secret, only to see the planned revenge raid fail spectacularly. A ferry then takes him on to Jersey, where he finds almost all of its beaches have a bunker or a machine gun post left over from the conflict.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Secrets of the Murder Bureau

Items brought in to be valued include a painting by John Singer Sergeant, a crystal decanter and an officer's coat from the American Civil War.

programme.title: Ganges
programme.desc: Exploring the story of the river, following its course from the Himalayas to their foothills. The programme reveals its enormous influence on the day-to-day living of a continent, how it has shaped Indian culture and religion and why it attracts a vast array of wildlife including snow leopards, Asiatic brown bears and bearded vultures.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough uses advanced surveillance technology to observe the feeding habits of herbivores, including elephants forced to undertake epic migrations to ensure a steady diet of the plants they need to survive. He also considers the habits of the sloth, which takes a month to digest each meal, and reveals scientific research suggesting that grazing wildebeest do not follow the rains as originally thought, but detect trails of phosphorus in the grass.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: The discovery of a wreck off the coast of Florida sends a team of underwater explorers on a mission to discover the identity of a ship that simply shouldn't exist.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene allows Boycie to buy a maximum of six cows for the farm - and is less than impressed when Elgin, Jed and Bryan turn up with a herd of 300. The vet is called out when Rocky the bull fails to take any notice of the females, and Tyler prepares to sit a local private school's entrance exam. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass

John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene discovers the farmhands concocting a virility potion for Rocky the bull, and manages to sneak a dose into Boycie's coffee. programme.desc: Capt Blackadder applies to join the Royal Flying Corps, seeing it as a great way of getting out of the trenches and into a classroom. Comedy, guest starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson, with Rowan Atkinson and Tony Robinson.

programme.title: Blackadder

programme.title: Blackadder

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Broughton Castle, near Banbury, Oxfordshire. Among the finds brought in to be valued are an art nouveau vase, a Georgian dolls' house, a Victorian baby bouncer, a letter from Lord Nelson, a book of early police mug shots, a collection of talismans and a musical penknife. Plus, Philip Mould meets a tax inspector who was paid in paintings by several artists.

programme.title: Impossible Railways

programme.title: Ganges
programme.desc: The final leg of the river's journey sees it join its tributary the Brahmaputra. As the waters merge, they overspill their banks to fan out into hundreds of smaller rivulets and create the world's largest delta. The programme reveals how people and wildlife survive the inhospitable habitat, perhaps the last place on Earth where the Bengal tiger is still king.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the hunting tactics of the world's carnivores. Arctic foxes in the frozen north must collect food during warmer times to survive the winter, while the big cats of the southern hemisphere rely on stealth and surprise to catch each meal. The presenter also reveals how leopards and tigers are solitary hunters, coming together only to mate, whereas lions stay in family groups so they can tackle larger prey and better protect their young.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber starts work on another O-level course, but wily old cellmate Fletcher can't understand why he doesn't just cheat in the exam. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge

programme.desc: The varied landscape of the tropical islands and the species that inhabit them, from flamingos and four-eyed fish to anteaters and cave-dwelling rodents. programme.title: Wild Caribbean
programme.desc: The effects of the region's powerful hurricanes on the islands' wildlife and the survival stories of some of the species, including how the Puerto Rican parrot almost became extinct. Offshore, lobsters head to deeper waters for refuge, while reefs benefit from the destruction.

programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. programme.title: Wild North
programme.desc: Deep in the forest, a female bear and three cubs emerge in the sunshine after hibernation. The first priority for the mother is to find food - and quickly, or her cubs will starve.

programme.title: Wild North
programme.desc: Far north in Svalbard, the polar bear depends on the ice to hunt seals. But with the ice receding, it has been forced to turn its attentions to a larger, trickier prey - the walrus.

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the connections between the wildlife, landscape and people of the Arabian peninsula. The first edition features animals including oryxes, jerboas, horned vipers and scorpions, and a journey with the Bedouin - camel-riding nomads who are the only humans to have mastered the art of survival in the desert. Narrated by Alexander Siddig.

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: Exploring the mountains of Dhofar in Oman, where the annual Indian Ocean monsoon has helped create a lost world of waterfalls and cloud forests filled with fascinating wildlife. The programme shows green sea turtles coming ashore in their thousands, shadowed by egg-stealing foxes, as well as footage of striped hyenas doing battle with Arabian wolves. Plus, a glimpse into the lives of chameleons, honey badgers and the elusive Arabian leopard.

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: The changes that have swept across the Arabian peninsula since the discovery of oil. Camel racing has become a hi-tech sport and the region's animals now live alongside a very modern society, but technology is also being used to protect nature. The programme reveals how dugongs are fitted with satellite transmitters and hunting falcons chase down radio-controlled planes, and follows the construction of the world's first carbon-neutral city. Narrated by Alexander Siddig.

Featuring performances never seen before by British viewers, and interviews with many of the artists who worked with them, including Diana Rigg, Glenda Jackson and Nicholas Parsons. programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The British airmen are forced to return to their hideout at Rene's cafe following a bungled escape attempt, and Edith continues to search for a new husband. Gorden Kaye and Carmen Silvera star.

programme.desc: The British send their finest French-speaking agent to say 'good moaning' to Rene and his colleagues and, dressed as a pantomime cow, the two airmen narrowly avoid being milked before going to a landing field to pick up their plane home.

Comedy, written by and starring Victoria Wood, with Thelma Barlow, Andrew Dunn, Celia Imrie and Shobna Gulati.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates historical evidence of the story of Jesus, examining his execution and his relationship with Mary Magdalene.

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit the Royal William Yard in Plymouth, where they are given the chance to cast their eyes over a number of potentially valuable items. On the waterfront, militaria expert Graham Lay has doubts about a pair of doorknobs thought to have belonged to Admiral Horatio Nelson. The team is impressed by a chess set made from parts of the aircraft carrier HMS Ark Royal, and a psychedelic painting of a band that performed at Woodstock intrigues Clive Stewart-Lockhart. Plus, jewellery specialist John Benjamin marvels at a diamond necklace the length of a skipping rope, donated to the city of Plymouth by Lady Astor.

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy narrates a documentary examining the lives of animals and people pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic, from the world's most powerful currents, ferocious hurricanes and huge chains of undersea volcanoes. The first episode looks at the influence of the Gulf Stream, with whales, giant turtles and jellyfish riding the huge current that becomes a migration super-highway and helps warm northern Europe, while fishermen battle for survival in mountainous seas as they try to exploit its natural fertility.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of omnivores, nature's generalists, revealing their myriad talents in the wild and how some species have adapted to man's encroachment into their habitats by making their homes in cities and towns.

programme.desc: Engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever, including technology that allows the navigation of the winding mountains of Spain at speed..

programme.desc: Arkwright hatches a plan to get into Nurse Gladys's bedroom by forcing a reluctant Granville to masquerade as a burglar, so the miserly shopkeeper can come to her rescue. Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron star.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason. Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels.

programme.desc: Granville tries to persuade Arkwright to buy a van, as he is fed up with having to struggle doing the rounds with the shop's outdated delivery bike. He is pleasantly surprised when his skinflint uncle agrees - until he takes the vehicle out on the road. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie secretly buys a load of artificial fertiliser to help his supposedly organic crops - but is seen unloading it by a neighbour, who promptly phones the Agricultural Office to complain about his behaviour. Starring John Challis.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: The local mayor becomes embroiled in a sex scandal, so Boycie decides to stand for election as his replacement - unaware Llewellyn is planning to do the same. Marlene is put in a tight spot when a schoolfriend of Tyler's confesses he has developed feelings for her. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie decides his staff need to work harder and vows to sack the next employee he catches slacking. Mrs Cakeworthy is the first out the door, but she soon has her boss regretting his decision when he learns she is a witch. John Challis, Sue Holderness and Ella Kenion star.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: Documentary about the Holocaust and some of the key figures involved, beginning with Hjalmar Schacht, who was never a Nazi but played a vital role in Hitler's plans.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The story of the Ahnenerbe research institute, which was set up to provide scientific backing to Hitler's ideology, through a series of horrific experiments.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Stasi: Behind the Berlin Wall
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston looks behind the hidden remnants of the Berlin Wall, a notorious symbol of division, to tell the story of the Stasi, East Germany's State Security Service.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The hunt for Gestapo head Klaus Barbie and death camp guard John Demjanjuk, dubbed 'The Butcher of Lyon' and 'Ivan the Terrible' respectively, which lasted into the 1980s.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit the Royal William Yard in Plymouth, where they are given the chance to cast their eyes over a number of potentially valuable items. On the waterfront, militaria expert Graham Lay has doubts about a pair of doorknobs thought to have belonged to Admiral Horatio Nelson. The team is impressed by a chess set made from parts of the aircraft carrier HMS Ark Royal, and a psychedelic painting of a band that performed at Woodstock intrigues Clive Stewart-Lockhart. Plus, jewellery specialist John Benjamin marvels at a diamond necklace the length of a skipping rope, donated to the city of Plymouth by Lady Astor.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever, including technology that allows the navigation of the winding mountains of Spain at speed..

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents from Plymouth's Royal William Yard. Items brought in to be valued include a ceremonial wooden spoon presented to the student who got the worst exam results in the history of Cambridge University, one of the last flasks of naval rum to be produced, a book of designs by a famous landscape gardener, a ceremonial hammer and chisel and some dolls' house furniture. One visitor discovers the brooch she bought in a charity shop is much older than she thought.

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Documentary examining the animals pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic. In the vast South Atlantic, huge pods of dolphins, massive penguin colonies and the largest gathering of marine mammals on Earth pack chains of extraordinary islands, created by powerful volcanic forces far below them. Meanwhile, the nutrient-rich upwellings create profusions of life in some areas, and the abyssal depths host a world of bizarre creatures in others.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough swims alongside sea otters, discovering he is no match for their natural agility in the water, while in Florida he takes a dip with manatees for the first time and observes their feeding habits. On the coast of California, he encounters the largest mammals on the planet, blue whales, and reveals how they, along with porpoises and dolphins, learned to court, mate and give birth in the water.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador..

programme.desc: The story of Hitler's former deputy Hermann Goering, who emerged from house arrest in May 1945 and made his way to American lines in the hope of surrendering to them rather than the Russians. After being imprisoned at Nuremberg, he committed suicide by poisoning in October 1946.

Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.desc: Eleanor is flattered by the attentions of charming Dr Hunter _ but when his housekeeper dies suddenly, she changes her opinion. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Charity Wakefield and Hattie Morahan lead the cast in Andrew Davies's adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel about a voyage of sexual and romantic discovery. Following the death of her husband, Mrs Dashwood and her daughters are forced to give up their home and move to a small cottage in Devonshire. Elinor is disappointed to leave her old home after falling in love with Edward Ferrars, her sister-in-law's brother, but looks forward to a promised visit. Marianne quickly finds she has an admirer in Colonel Brandon but is swept of her feet by neighbour Willoughby.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Colonel Brandon is called away on urgent business, leaving Marianne free to fall blissfully in love with Willoughby - until he too suddenly leaves for London. Meanwhile, Elinor has a disappointing meeting with Edward, but the reasons for his distant behaviour become clear when Sir John's niece Lucy Steele entrusts her with a shocking secret.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Marianne's health deteriorates as Colonel Brandon reveals the full extent of Willoughby's betrayal. Meanwhile, Edward states his intentions to honour his engagement to Lucy Steele, despite being disinherited by his mother as a result. Charity Wakefield and Dominic Cooper star.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Olivia expresses her reservations about the artist Lloyd Ellis Parker to James, while Rene is distraught to learn about Sarah's pregnancy. Meanwhile, Carolyn confronts George about Regina, and Elizabeth has lunch with Douglas Goddard.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.sub-title: In the Heat of the Night
programme.desc: George takes Sarah to hospital after finding her at the side of the road, while Olivia continues her relationship with Lloyd, but is distraught when James discovers the affair.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth feels harassed by a combination of working at a charity shop, trying to impress Councillor Nugent and worrying about Rose's love life. To cap it all, Daisy informs her that a strange woman in Daddy's bedroom claims to be his fiance. Starring Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Daisy tries to encourage Onslow to notice her by picking up a toy boy in the hope of making him jealous. Meanwhile, Hyacinth forces Elizabeth and Richard to help her organise a social occasion at the church hall. Patricia Routledge and Judy Cornwell star.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth attends the christening of Daisy's granddaughter, and is displeased to learn the child's parents are not married. With some encouragement from Richard, she agrees to keep an open mind, but is later irked when the mother and child go missing. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: While the world anxiously awaits the resolution of the Cuban Missile Crisis, Valerie treats a pregnant Somali woman who has undergone female genital circumcision. The Nonnatus Team arrange for her to go into hospital, but she responds by going into hiding, and the situation is complicated further when it emerges that the woman's younger sister will soon go through the same process. Sister Mary Cynthia's depression is treated with electroconvulsive therapy, which she hopes will restore her faith.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.desc: The investigator tackles a case in North Queensland involving the discovery on a beach of the body of a parks and conservation officer with a number of shark bites on it. Poisonous jellyfish found in the victim's stomach raise suspicions as to the true nature of his demise. Harrow reconnects with Dr Laurie Badcoe, his other mentor besides Jack, who assures him that Francis Chester is dead. Ioan Gruffudd stars.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: When a troubled gambler is murdered at a greyhound track it seems that his enormous debts have cost him his life. The investigation leads Ross and the team from race-fixing to sex tapes, and in the midst of it all one of their suspects - who include the victim's ex-wife and a dog handler with dark secrets - turns up dead. Detective drama, starring John Michie, Blythe Duff and Alex Norton.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: A woman leaves her estate to her son Alexander, who disappeared in Italy during World War Two on condition he claims the inheritance by 2010. When a mysterious stranger turns up at the funeral to claim the inheritance, he is called an imposter by the rest of the family. The quest for the truth finds Dalziel and Pascoe uncovering dark family secrets, including murder, betrayal, mad dogs, gay bars, young love and a revealing birthmark. Feature-length drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan, with Margaret Tyzack, Jamie Glover and Jack Hedley.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Concluding part. Jonathan Southwood is taken in for questioning, during which a series of shocking revelations point to the true murderer. Walker faces a race against time to reach Connor, who is working undercover at a private club where Colin Thorpe is putting her professionalism to the ultimate test. Crime drama, starring Victoria Smurfit, David Hayman and Nicholas Farrell.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: A forgetful clock-mender contacts the sleuth when he becomes the target of a couple of small-time crooks. Armed with advice from DCI Adams, Hetty starts her investigation at a video store and soon discovers that there is more to the case than meets the eye.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.sub-title: The Sign of the Broken Sword
programme.desc: A murder is committed at the local army barracks using a legendary broken sword, and the incident leads the priest to investigate another death at Dunkirk 13 years previously. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When Kembleford's new cricket captain is framed for murder, Father Brown must prove his innocence to give his team any chance of beating neighbouring village Hambleston. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The apparent suicide of a troubled student at Upcott Seminary leads Father Brown to believe a murderer is at work, and he tries to persuade Sid to go undercover in an attempt to flush out the killer. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When the father of a young writer is found dead, tensions mount against the travellers in Kembleford, and the priest races to find out who actually committed the murder before one of them is wrongly sent to the gallows. Starring Mark Williams, Nathalie Buscombe and Philip McGinley.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Colour Blind
programme.desc: Drama from the best-selling author. Set between the wars, it concerns a girl who returns to her Tyneside home newly married to her black husband, only to encounter bigotry from all sides, to say nothing of her obsessed brother's animosity. Niamh Cusack, Tony Armatrading and Dearbhla Molloy star.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest and his friends find themselves stranded with a group of hedonists and are desperate to escape, fearful that their lives are in danger. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

credits.actor: Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A body is discovered in a vineyard and Father Brown is tasked with searching for the murderer among a group of suspects who are all seeking to reinvent themselves. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest becomes embroiled in an audacious art heist masterminded by his adversary Flambeau, who intends to use Father Brown and his friends to help him settle an old score. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest encounters a man who intends to solve his father's murder a year earlier with the use of his brand-new invention - a time machine. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates when a body is found at the stone circle in a polio-stricken village, leading him to conclude that dark forces are involved - and another sacrifice could be imminent. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When a man is found dead inside a locked bank vault, Father Brown must solve the mystery to save an innocent man from paying the ultimate price. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest finds himself in a seemingly impossible situation when he is told during a confession that Bishop Talbot will be assassinated tomorrow. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest is stunned when he realises that the fugitive seeking sanctuary at St Mary's is Inspector Sullivan - and the man is wanted for murder. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Tom Chambers and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra and her seasoned colleagues reopen the case of a political aide's murder when a dormant offshore bank account containing 40,000 is discovered in his name. Ben Ransley was killed in 1997 on the evening of Labour's landslide victory and in his wallet was a photo of a beautiful blonde. But neither his mother nor his best friend was able to identify the mystery woman. Is she the key to the crime? Drama, with former Brookside star John McArdle (Billy Corkhill), Jason Durr of Heartbeat fame and one-time Bad Girls actress Kika Mirylees joining Denis Lawson, Dennis Waterman and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam investigates the suspicious death of elderly Jewish brothers Jake and Henry Davies, unearthing evidence of a racist connection. Starring Amanda Burton, Ahsen Bhatti and Andrew Sachs.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII sets out to establish himself as the new sovereign, but finds a dangerous, deeply divided kingdom. Lizzie's loyalties are further complicated by the child she is expecting. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The regiment's tour in Germany is cut short. Meanwhile, a prank in the Officer's Mess causes trouble for Tucker. Starring Robson Green and Rob Spendlove.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Transatlantic rivalry breaks out when the officers have to share a barracks with a platoon of American soldiers. Starring Jerome Flynn and Gary Love.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam Okaro returns to Sun Hill, where he resumes his role as Superintendent - and immediately asks Jo Masters to find out how the press obtained a photo of Lesley Palmer. Meanwhile, Smithy and Laura Bryant continue to investigate the real Gabriel Kent's identity - and try to fathom the true nature of his relationship with June Ackland.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Gina's condition deteriorates, prompting her to ask for Connie's help to ensure a dignified death, but finds her friend is unimpressed with her negative attitude. Matt investigates the tampered drugs, learning more medicines are affected than he had realised, and Ric undertakes a risky operation, despite the CEO's objection that the patient is dangerously overweight.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Remembrance Day proves eventful in Holby A&E, as Finlay deals with a patient who would prefer to forget the past, and Duffy doesn't need reminding it's her 40th birthday, an occasion complicated by her husband's imminent arrival on the ward. Charlie enjoys a final outing with his Canada-bound son, only for the day to turn into a nightmare. Medical drama, starring Cathy Shipton, Derek Thompson and Kwame Kwei-Armah.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jo Masters and Samantha Nixon continue to hunt for the missing Lesley Palmer - a case given added urgency by the subsequent disappearance of her ex-boyfriend Stewart Jenson. Smithy and Laura Bryant discover the unidentified hospital patient is June's real son, while Terry Perkins and Phil Hunter investigate a sudden death - but soon find they also have a burglary on their hands.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat gets a surprise when her estranged son David turns up on her doorstep.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sanjay's trying to speak to Gita but she's still too upset about his affair. David Wicks is introducing himself round the square and aunt Nellie arrives at the Fowlers.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A bungled burglary leads to a gruesome task for the Blue Watch team, and Dutch firefighter Marianne joins the watch on exchange.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Dr Jack Kerruish leaves Africa hoping to become a country GP, while Beth Glover and Will Preston are looking for a partner to join their Derbyshire practice. First episode of the rural medical drama, starring Kevin Whately, Amanda Burton and.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ozias Harding makes his presence felt in Skelthwaite by ruthlessly firing Alan from the factory, while Luke is rushed to hospital after a serious accident on the rugby field, and Beth has a chance to test her maternal instincts when she is asked to lead the children's Moon Catching Expedition. Starring Brian Capron, Keith Barron, Christian Cooke and Kerrie Taylor.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie discovers a medieval recipe for traditional liquor among some ancient scrolls and goes into full-scale production, building a distillery in his barn and buying up all the potatoes he can find. The business goes well, but his success attracts some unwelcome visitors - the Driscoll brothers. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Mysterious Feet of Nora Batty
programme.desc: Wally is called upon to settle an argument between Compo and Foggy - the exact size of Nora Batty's feet. Bill Owen, Kathy Staff and Joe Gladwin star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The discovery of an abandoned mattress leads Foggy to embark on an town-wide clean-up campaign. Brian Glover guest stars in the rural comedy, with Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: A black man is murdered in a jail cell by a confirmed racist - a crime the prison service blames on overcrowding. However, the judge's probing reveals the institution wasn't operating at full capacity. A drink-driving appeal puts the bench at loggerheads, and Jo distances herself from her former lover. With Donald Sinden and Jenny Seagrove.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A photo featuring a missing 19-year-old music student turns up in a charity shop donation bag on the anniversary of her disappearance 17 years earlier, prompting Sandra to suspect the work of a serial killer. However, as the team gets to work identifying and tracking down the other people in the picture, increasing pressure to hand over the investigation forces Sandra to consider her future, and she turns to a familiar face to help her make her decision. Amanda Redman stars, with Denis Lawson, Dennis Waterman and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan is assigned to investigate the case of two murdered teenage girls whose frozen bodies have been uncovered by an avalanche in Norway. Post-mortem results show they were strangled 15 years apart and as investigations proceed, suspicion falls on a friend of one victim's family. Drama, starring Amanda Burton and Anthony Head.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Elizabeth struggles through her labour, while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Negotiations are jeopardised by a twist of fate, and Lizzie learns she has more in common with her husband than she first imagined. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The York princesses are strategically married off to strengthen the Tudor cause, but further political challenges are on the horizon. When King Henry finds himself back on the battlefield to protect his reign, Lizzie learns that the threats they face may be closer to home. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The fusiliers return to the UK and take up guard duty at Windsor Castle, while also preparing to take part in a memorial ceremony for the anniversary of the D-Day landings.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A football match is cut short when trouble arises. Elsewhere, Nelson has problems with his girlfriend, and Paddy faces a few home truths.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jo Masters and Samantha Nixon continue to hunt for the missing Lesley Palmer - a case given added urgency by the subsequent disappearance of her ex-boyfriend Stewart Jenson. Smithy and Laura Bryant discover the unidentified hospital patient is June's real son, while Terry Perkins and Phil Hunter investigate a sudden death - but soon find they also have a burglary on their hands.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Gina asks for more help from Connie as she plans her trip to Switzerland for an assisted suicide, leaving the surgeon with a difficult moral dilemma. Ric learns Bradley has been receiving gifts from the hospital's drug supplier, and the pair's investigation into the medication problem uncovers a counterfeit pill-maker in the warehouse.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Duffy is less than impressed when her doctor husband makes a dramatic entrance on his first day at the hospital, and wonders whether their marriage can survive the stress of a professional relationship. Charlie is forced to come to terms with giving up Louis as he prepares to take the youngster to Canada, and Chloe regrets telling Spencer about Barney's alcoholic father. Medical drama, starring Cathy Shipton and Derek Thompson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Smithy discovers Gabriel's real name is actually David Kent. Understandably taken aback, he nevertheless prevents June from telling Okaro. Unfortunately Laura also knows the truth, and lacks his resolve. Filled with righteous indignation, she blurts out the entire sorry saga to a shell-shocked Sheelagh - who blunders headlong into danger as she investigates. On the professional front, Terry investigates an attack on his sister-in-law.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Jerry's furious with Meena after Gita told him she had an affair with Sanjay. Jules is back in the square and is looking for Hattie. Aunt Nellie causes tension at the Fowler's..

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The fall out of Sanjays affair with Mena comes to a head, when Mena tries to make amends with Gita. David confronts Pat with some harsh truths and Phil suspects Ian's up to no good.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team races to extinguish a blazing marquee at a school fete, but their new gold uniforms make them a laughing-stock for the other crews in attendance.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: The Beeches finally becomes a paying concern - but Beth's relief at its new-found solvency is cut short by the discovery that a rival fund-holding trust is stealing patients at an alarming rate. Her frustration is tempered by a growing attraction to newcomer Jack Kerruish - but his professional approach continues to be a source of friction. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna is unsure whether she should tell Luke the truth about his chances of recovery after his near-fatal rugby accident, and Ozias Harding's persistent bullying forces Billy to resign from the factory, leading Nathan to take revenge against the businessman by asking out his daughter Alice. Lesley Dunlop, Brian Capron and Andrew Paul star.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon's husband Chris becomes seriously ill, leaving her facing a difficult decision. Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph star in an episode featuring an early screen appearance by Doon Mackichan.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie senses an opportunity to get himself knighted when Marlene becomes heavily involved in charity work. Enlisting the help of their staff, Marlene tries to make it happen using her contacts, but achieving her husband's dream turns out to be harder than expected. Comedy, starring John Challis.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In his latest attempt to impress Nora Batty, Compo borrows Crusher Milburn's bright red motorcycle and dons racing leathers to become a daredevil biker. Comedy, starring Bill Owen, with Kathy Staff.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy, Compo and Clegg spot Digby chasing his donkey around his paddock. Foggy claims that a little planning will see the beast caught, and volunteers the trio to complete the task. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The detective looks into the suspicious death of an old friend and informant. The investigation leads him to the local police station, where it becomes clear the officers are hiding something - and to complicate matters, the disappearance of a teenage boy is also linked to the case. Crime drama, with Martin Shaw, Lee Ingleby and guest stars Neil Pearson, Dean Lennox Kelly and Mark Benton.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: After Sandra's departure, the detectives are anxious to meet their new boss, and DCI Sasha Miller wastes no time getting cracking with her first Ucos case, the murder of an Italian immigrant on a west London allotment 25 years earlier. The ritualistic style of the killing puts one of the other gardeners in the frame when it's revealed he is a practising druid. However, as the investigation continues, Gerry becomes suspicious of Sasha - why is she kissing a senior officer? Tamzin Outhwaite joins the cast as DCI Miller, with Dennis Waterman, Denis Lawson and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan suspects foul play when she is called in to investigate the apparent suicide of a headmaster's wife. Attempting to arrange a special autopsy, she finds that her superiors don't share her view, appearing more concerned with her failing health _ and without the evidence she needs, a murderer could still be at large. Feature-length episode of the drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Lizzie must deal with her mother's bold defence of the York cause, while the appearance of a boy in Burgundy claiming to be a young prince threatens to further destabilise King Henry's rule. King Henry's mother Lady Margaret Beaufort faces the consequences of harbouring a dark secret. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII and Lizzie travel to Spain to secure their son's betrothal, but find news of their country's instability has preceded them. Meanwhile, unrest growing in Burgundy spills over into an English battle. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Harry's Heroes: Euro Having a Laugh
programme.desc: In the final episode, Harry, John and the team embark on the final leg of the tour in Germany, as they prepare to face their arch-rivals at the Wacker Arena in Burghausen. After checking into their Hotel in the Bavarian Alps, Harry receives the German team sheet, leaving him concerned his team are going to have to massively step up their game. With the fear of the match going to penalties hanging over their head, Harry brings in a German psychologist to offer some advice. Finally the big day arrives, and Harry has managed to recruit Manchester United legend Teddy Sheringham, so the team finally has its missing striker.

programme.title: Freeze Out
programme.desc: Game show of skill and quizzing ability in which contestants compete at a giant circular ice table for the chance to manoeuvre gliding sliders on a large game board, hoping to eventually secure a jackpot of 10,000. Hosted by Mark Durden-Smith, with former Premier League referee Uriah Rennie.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: The Race for a Cure: Making Britain Safe - Tonight
programme.desc: Ranj Singh looks at the urgent race to find drugs to successfully treat Covid-19. With hopes of defeating the deadly virus lying with the world's scientists - including those working in Britain - Dr Singh gains first-hand access to laboratories and drug trials across the country. He reports on the unprecedented scientific efforts going into developing drugs to treat those in hospital with the virus, as well as the search for a vaccine to inoculate everyone. With the success of these trials determining how soon people can resume normal life and get the economy running as before, the stakes could not be higher.

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals

Alan Titchmarsh's challenge is to create a more child-friendly garden for their terraced home in Tonbridge, and his first task is to make a shady environment so the kids can spend time outside in the day. After that, he and the team come up with a bespoke lighting system for the evenings, acoustic fencing to cut down the noise from a nearby railway line, and an area for the parents.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase

They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Drama series, starring Martin Clunes as a surgeon who takes up a post in a sleepy Cornish village. Martin has to rush Buddy the dog to the vets. Meanwhile, Mrs Tishell's young cousin Sarah joins her for some work experience, but it does not go to plan, and one of Louisa's clients arrives at the surgery unannounced, posing a dilemma.

credits.actor: Martin Clunes as a surgeon who takes up a post in a sleepy Cornish village

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson steps into Chris Tarrant's shoes to host the first edition of the revival of the quiz. Contestants sit in the famous chair to answer a maximum of 15 questions, hoping to win 1million and join original millionaires Judith Keppel, David Edwards, Robert Brydges, Pat Gibson and Ingram Wilcox. Each player has four lifelines - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50:50 and Ask the Host - at their disposal.

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: When potential witness Claire Olssen is intimidated into changing her statement, the investigation team look for alternative ways to reinforce their case. As Steve returns to work, Kelly is offered a deal that tests his resolve.

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals
programme.desc: Documentary revealing how Queen Elizabeth II has mastered the art of being a monarch, both home and abroad, over her record-breaking 68-year reign. She is seen meeting world leaders such as Ronald Reagan, Mikhail Gorbachev and Donald Trump - although not all encounters go well, and the film also looks at the Queen's commitment to the Commonwealth, a personal project that has seen the old Empire transformed.

programme.title: Secrets of the Driving Test
programme.desc: Cocksure 17-year-old Bethany is barely out of the test centre before getting into a game of chicken. Drew and Julie are back and eager to improve on their catastrophic first tests, while in Blackpool, retired policeman Philip is hoping a pass will finally stop his wife telling him how to drive.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Fern Britton hosts another culinary showdown, judged this week by Rosemary Shrager, who begins by demonstrating how to peel, cut and slice pears into fans, before giving the contestants five minutes to copy what she has just done. Six hopefuls go through to the next stage where they have to French trim pork chops, before the final three use the meat to create the best pork dish they can.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jamie and Andrea return, Moira is stung by Cain, and Mandy wants Paul to go.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: David is chased by an angry mob and cornered in an alleyway, while the doctor warns Leanne that it is too soon to be sure, but Oliver may have suffered brain damage. Tommy Orpington assures James he did the right thing coming out, and Chesney urges Gemma to share her vlog online.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Manchester-born brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on an epic journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the fifth episode, Adam attempts to master an ancient sport when he and Scott get a taste of Indian parklife. Elsewhere, Ryan and Dougie make a shock discovery about Dougie's grandmother, before the group join in with the festivities for the country's biggest party for Diwali.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul helps to feed a pair of week-old kittens whose mother has abandoned them. However, as the kittens grow older, the team discover that one of them has a neurological problem affecting his movement. Later, Paul meets a group of dogs from a puppy farm who have had very little human interaction in the past, and need help learning how to socialise.

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: Mercer and his associates are tried for their roles in the killing of 11-year-old Rhys Jones, but the verdict fails to bring closure for the boy's parents Melanie and Steve as the fractures in their relationship come to a head. Meanwhile an unexpected setback leaves Det Supt Dave Kelly with a tough decision to make. The concluding part of the fact-based drama centred on the devastating impact of a child's murder amid a wave of gang violence in Liverpool, starring Stephen Graham, Sinead Keenan and Bran F O'Byrne.
